event.summary: 01/22/1993: Four unknown perpetrators fired at a guard of the Coca Cola Bottling Company in Lima, Peru, and then detonated a car bomb, killing two and injuring two others. Heavy property damage was reported.
event.target1: Coca Cola Bottling Company office in Lima
event.weapdetail: 300 Kilograms of dynamite and ANFO (ammonium nitrate fuel oil) were used in the attack.
event.propcomment: The attack caused major damage to the Coca Cola Bottling Company Office. Other nearby factories also suffered extensive damage.
event.addnotes: Two of the casualties were Juan Luna Balbas and Cesar Ayala, security guards who worked at the plant. A second car bomb damaged a Coca-Cola distribution center in Lima later in the day; there was no further information available on this bombing.
